course_description: Contemporary theory that positions itself between beginning principles and work in theory at the graduate level, primarily treating economic theory as it relates to consumers, business enterprises, and factor markets.
prerequisites: (ECON 101 or ECON_OX 101) and (MATH 111 or MATH 111L or MATH_OX 101) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4210, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: D. Ludwinski, Status: Open
